content.description: Which of the following code segments can be used to create the desired new string and store it in newStr ?
content.question: Select two answers.

choices.label: left <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1)right <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr))newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(left, right)

left <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n + 1)right <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n - 1, len(oldStr))newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(left, right)

newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1)newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(newStr, substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr)))

newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr))newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(newStr, substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1))

content.answer: left <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, 1, n - 1)right <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> substring(oldStr, n + 1, len(oldStr))newStr <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> concat(left, right)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Use abstraction to manage complexity in a program.
